results.title: First Touch
results.brief_description: Using archival films of the Apollo lunar missions in the late 1960s and early 70s, this 2 screen video installation contemplates humankind’s first touch of the moon. Often considered a giant leap in human development, the video concentrates on the delicate and hesitant movements of the astronauts and their spaceships as they overcome the limits of outer space. With both humour and melancholy, stunning images of the moon, the earth, and the astronauts and their spacecraft, are interwoven into a wondrous contemplation of this extraordinary achievement.

results.title: First still of Black Hole
results.brief_description: The Event Horizon Telescope—a planet-scale array of ground-based radio telescopes—has obtained the first image of a supermassive black hole and its shadow. The image, taken in 2019, reveals the central black hole of Messier 87, a massive galaxy in the Virgo cluster.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

constellations_other.name: Space, cinema and fakes
constellations_other.description: Before and after humans stepped foot on the moon, outer-space and the stars have inspired filmmakers, artists and game makers to imagine what's beyond our atmosphere.

results.title: First steps to sharemarket investment
results.brief_description: This video is aimed, primarily, at those people interested in making their first move into the world of investment. In it, Susan Manson, B.Ec., Education Officer for the Australian Stock Exchange, Melbourne, takes you step by step through all the aspects of equity investments. In short, everything you ever wanted to know to become a knowledgeable participant in the market.

results.title: First steps
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Stanley Jackson, Colin Low, Philip Bridgeman and Alec MacLeod
results.brief_description: Overview of a Canadian program called “First steps” which is designed to provide extra stimulation and structured learning situations for children who are born with intellectual retardation. Suitable for tertiary levels. (Awards: Vancouver; Columbus; Salerno).

results.title: First steps
results.creator_credit: Frederic House Inc for the Department of Social Affairs of the United Nations and Leo Seltzer
results.brief_description: Deals with the treatment and care of children crippled by cerebral palsy and poliomyelitis. The program of treatment is designed to integrate children into society. Demonstrates how training and practice in the handling of toys and hobby materials can be transformed into handling of tools and utensils necesary for everyday life. Photographed in a summer camp, the film ends as a small boy leaves his parents to take his first steps on a crowded city street. Academy Award winner for best short documentary 1947. Narrated by Winston O’Keefe.

results.title: First Sino-Japanese War = 甲午风云
results.creator_credit: Nong Lin, Changchun Film Company and Yi Xi
results.brief_description:
The film deals specifically with two naval conflicts at Fengdao Island and the Yellow Sea, during the 1894 Sino-Japanese War. The Chinese navy encounters the Japanese on the sea and, because of secret deals and the cowardice of the Chinese officers, refuses to engage them. The ordinary seamen aboard the Chinese vessel are outraged and eventually mutiny to fight the Japanese. The mutineers later join another vessel which is captained by a die-hard patriot and fighting man who leads them to a minor victory. The film ends on this positive note that the Chinese people have always been loyal and willing to fight, and its military losses were due largely to the corrupt and weak upper classes.
The film, which can be considered as war propaganda, avoids the Chinese navy’s humiliating military defeat by blaming the corrupt officials and ranking officers, who lacked the courage and will to sacrifice for their country. These heroic qualities are instead held by those low-ranking seamen, who have been disenfranchised by China’s then feudal system. The film invokes strong pejorative cultural and moral stereotypes against the Japanese, who all dress in extravagant Western clothes and hatch vile diplomatic schemes to defraud the Chinese people from a clean and honest fight. The film should in no way be taken as a historically reliable account of the events that unfolded during the Sino-Japanese War. However, it is a keen insight into the historical revisionism and aspirations of the Chinese Communist Government which dealt a critical hand in producing the film.
(Awards: 1983 - Winner of Portugal’s 12th Festroia International Film Festival’s Jury Prize.)
(James Donald, 3 star rating, 2010).

results.title: First Screening: Computer Poems
results.brief_description: A suite of a dozen kinetic poems programmed in Apple BASIC. Later, as the first versions became inaccessible, the works were recreated in HyperCard in the early 1990s (after bpNichol’s death), and then in 2007 recreated in javascript for the web, and simultaneously the original BASIC and Hypercard files were republished for download.

constellations_other.name: Pen names, poems and puppets
constellations_other.description: Discover how big-screen adaptations of novels connect to web-based poetry and Jim Henson's Fraggle Rock.

results.title: First of all, water
results.creator_credit: Radio Sweden, AB Nordisk Filmkopia and Ake Backlund
results.brief_description: The film aims to draw attention to the possibilities available for detecting and reaching subsoil water. Swedish scientists have made a great contribution as regards getting hold of, quickly and at reasonable cost, life-giving, pure water.

results.title: First men into space
results.brief_description: This film is concerned with solving space survival problems. It recreates, with live photography, animation and scale models, the first American orbital space flight, and illustrates some problems of man’s survival in the hostile environment.

results.title: First mate
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Jane Karslake
results.brief_description: Clarrie and Lex are mutually supportive old mates. However, the onset of senility threatens and finally destroys their independence. Good performances and sensitive portrayal of problems of aged men.
